page.title: 07IMMIGRATION IN PAISLEY
page.content: Our school has about four hundred and seventy pupils five percent of which are Asian. Wun Man Chau is Chinese. His parents were born in Hong Kong and came here to find a business _ a Chinese food carry out. His mum helps local Chinese people to learn English at night school. At home the family speak Chinese and English, they like to eat Chinese food and celebrate Festivals such as Chinese New Year. Occasionally they visit relatives in Hong Kong and sometimes aunts and uncles visit the Chau's Paisley home for celebrations and family gatherings. Wun Man feels more Scottish than Chinese, wearing Western clothes and is involved in various local clubs e.g. the B.B. He has many Scottish friends and a local accent!
